s0718: The Empress Dowager said: "Your lordship is wrong, it is not as serious as with Chang'an Jun."
s0719: The Left Minister Tang Ju said: "Parents who love their children plan deeply for them.
s0720: When the old woman sent off the Yan Queen, holding her heels, weeping for her, thinking of her distance, it was also pitiable.
s0721: After she left, it is not that she did not think of her, at sacrifices she prayed saying 'May she never return', was this not planning for the long term, for her sons and grandsons to succeed as kings?"
s0723: The Left Minister said: "Now going back three generations, among the sons and grandsons of Zhao lords who became marquises, are there any whose succession still exists?"
s0725: He said: "Not only Zhao, are there any among the feudal lords whose succession still exists?"
s0726: She said: "This old woman has not heard of any."
s0727: He said: "This is because those close suffered calamity in their own persons, those far suffered calamity in their sons and grandsons.

s0729: Their position is honored but without merit, their emolument is generous but without labor, and they monopolize many heavy treasures.
s0730: Now your ladyship honors Chang'an Jun's position, and enfeoffs him with fertile lands, gives him many heavy treasures, but does not make him have merit for the state now. Once the mountain tomb collapses, how will Chang'an Jun entrust himself to Zhao?
